nodes.bodyText: Do you know why this was here before and why we no longer need it?

Perhaps a bit of a drive-by change. I'm not sure why we were normalizing the output this way. @jamesonwilliams?
I removed it as it isn't customary to replace spaces with underscores in User-Agent header values generally.

Mohit Srivastava & Nikhil Dabhade had requested that we use the same format as is used in the SDK.
However, my guess is that not a ton of thought had gone into designing the SDK one, previously. More just that it had set a formatting precedence.
Anyway, the SDK had this _ character, among other weird choices (several of which John is correcting in this PR.)
If the _ is weird, let's get rid of it. The best outcome is a well-formatted and usable User-Agent string.
